intro: Amphorocalyx rupestris, commonly known as the rock amphora, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, urn-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water. The flowers, which are often brightly colored, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
